sentence: Many  are  returning  home  to  learn  that  their  loved  ones  were  killed  on  Oct.  7  or  are  still  being  held  in  Gaza.
That's  what  the  family  of  four-year-old  Abigail  Idan  —  a  dual  American-Israeli  citizen  whose  parents  were  among  the  some  1,200  people  killed  on  Oct.  7  —  told  NPR.

"I  think  that  we  will  only  learn  as  the  days  go  on,  and  for  a  long  time,  what  really  effectively  will  be  the  results  of  having  been  a  hostage  and  having  been  in  her  father's  arms  when  he  was  murdered,"  Hirsh  Naftali  said.
More  than  13,300  Palestinians  —  roughly  two-thirds  of  them  women  and  minors  —  have  been  killed  since  the  war  began,  according  to  the  Health  Ministry  in  Hamas-ruled  Gaza.
